title: Chinese Garlic Tofu and Broccoli Stir-Fry
ingredients: 14 oz firm tofu, pressed and cut into 3/4-inch cubes
4 green onions, cut into 1-inch pieces (white and green parts separated)
instructions: 1. Press tofu between paper towels for 10 minutes to remove excess moisture, then cut into 3/4-inch cubes. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice vinegar, cornstarch, water, sesame oil, sugar, and white pepper; set aside. 3. Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes in a single layer and cook undisturbed for 3-4 minutes until golden brown on the bottom. Flip and cook another 2-3 minutes until crispy on multiple sides. Remove tofu and set aside. 4. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the same pan. Add broccoli florets and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons water, cover, and steam for 2-3 minutes until broccoli is bright green and tender-crisp. 5. Push broccoli to the sides of the pan. Add minced garlic, ginger (if using), and white parts of green onions to the center. Stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. 6. Return tofu to the pan. Pour the sauce mixture over everything and toss to coat. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens and coats the tofu and broccoli. 7. Add green parts of green onions and toss for 30 seconds. 8. Serve immediately over steamed rice.
description: A savory Chinese-style stir-fry featuring crispy pan-fried tofu and tender broccoli in a flavorful garlic sauce with aromatic green onions
